name: rabimbieq
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1

stmt.origin: eqtri(c0, crab(s0, c1, w0), crab(s0, c1, w1))

body.origin:
|- wceq(c0, crab(s0, c1, w0))
-| wceq(c0, crab(s0, c1, w1))
-| wceq(crab(s0, c1, w1), crab(s0, c1, w0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(c0, crab(s0, c1, w0))
-| wceq(c0, crab(s0, c1, w1))
-| wceq(crab(s0, c1, w1), crab(s0, c1, w0))

body.origin:
|- wceq(crab(s0, c1, w1), crab(s0, c1, w0))
-| wi(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wb(w1, w0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(c0, crab(s0, c1, w0))
-| wceq(c0, crab(s0, c1, w1))
-| wi(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wb(w1, w0))

comment: Restricted equivalent wff's correspond to restricted class abstractions which are equal with the same class. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 22-Jul-2021.)
